duties_responsibilities.duty: Recruit and build a vibrant team of workers for Children’s Ministry classes, events, and worship services.
Run background checks on all new volunteers, ensure we do all due diligence in vetting team members
Equip and train volunteer leaders with the tools they need to feel prepared and to be successful
Clearly articulate to team members the expectations, and have a follow-up plan for situations in which a team member needs development
Include team members in the creative process for executing an engaging environment
Provide a welcoming, upbeat atmosphere for children and families
Connect with new families with children in the church
Utilize channels of communication such as email, social media, and messaging to stay engaged with families
Select and provide curriculum appropriate for various levels of child development
Develop & maintain safe check-in, check-out procedures for children’s ministry
Build a check-in team that is welcoming and knowledgeable about Children’s Ministry
As Children’s Director, be involved with leadership of Children’s Church services
Have necessary materials and supplies prepared and in the team’s hands no later than 5 days prior to the day that they serve
Work cooperatively with NLC staff and volunteers
Attend weekly Staff Meetings and once monthly All Staff Meetings
Coordinate Children’s Ministry outreaches and special events (Yearly Summer Camp, Kids Convention, VBS)
Prepare special elements for holidays, including Mother’s Day, Father’s Day, Christmas, Easter

education_certification.credential: A degree or certificate in biblical or theological studies is preferred, but based on experience can be waived with the expectation of continued education
Hold ministerial credentials within the Assemblies of God is preferred (or plan to obtain AG credentialing)
Understanding of our responsibilities within the Mandatory Reporting requirements in cases of known or suspected abuse
